page.title: 11THE DERG IN THE 18TH CENTURY
page.content: {continued from page 10.} There was great laughter, which continued as long as we were hearing; for in an Irish fair there is as much good humour in the morning as there is quarrelling at night." "We walked up the rugged hill that leads to Castle Gore. Though, not many years ago, the seat of grandeur and magnificence, Castle Gore is now almost as absolute a picture of desolation as I ever beheld. Yet it is interesting even in decay; elevatednon a high hill, it is seen in every direction, and the antique avenue of old trees has further effect of beauty, in this land of mountains and floods."
